Detailed Description

Layout function declarations and types.

Function Documentation

lay_statep lay_create_state (   ) 
 

Create an internal state structure for use with subsequent liblayout functions.

When finished, must be destroyed using lay_destroy_state().

void lay_optimize (  lay_statep  state  ) 
 

Optimize the position of the input rectangles.

Overwrites the current positions with optimized positions.

void lay_register_rects (  lay_statep  state,
lay_coord_t *  rect_pos,
const ptrdiff_t  pos_skip,
lay_extent_t *  rect_size,
const ptrdiff_t  size_skip,
const int  count
) 
 

Register the positions and sizes of a set of rectangles with liblayout.

Parameters:
state The internal state structure.
rect_pos A pointer to the x-coordinate of the first size. The y-coordinate of the first size is assumed to exist at *(rect_pos + 1). The pointer can be NULL, but no operations requiring sizes may be used.
pos_skip The number of bytes to add to rect_pos to get to the x-coordinate of the next size. If zero, then the data is assumed to be tightly packed, and pos_skip will be set to 2 * sizeof(lay_coord_t). Can be negative.
rect_size A pointer to the width of the first size. The height of the first size is assumed to exist at *(p + 1). The pointer can be NULL, but no operations requiring sizes may be used.
size_skip The number of bytes to add to p to get to the width of the next size. If zero, then the data is assumed to be tightly packed, and skip will be set to 2 * sizeof(lay_extent_t). Can be negative.
count The number of rectangles.
